text: 3. A person performing professional activities in commercial or service facilities or commercial or service outlets may, during the performance of these professional activities, fulfill the obligation referred to in paragraph 1, by covering the mouth and nose with a visor, if all cash points or places of sale or service provision are the facility or facility is separated from the customers by an additional protective screen.

REGULATION OF THE MINISTER OF HEALTH of April 6, 2020 on infectious diseases resulting in the obligation of hospitalization, isolation or isolation in home conditions and the obligation of quarantine or epidemiological supervision

Wprzypadku nieustania okoliczności będą-cych przyczyną zmiany terminów minister właściwy do spraw zdrowia dokonuje ponownej zmiany tych termi-nów, jednak łączny okres przesunięcia danego terminu nie może być dłuższy niż 5miesięcy. Informację ozmia-nie tych terminów minister właściwy do spraw zdrowia ogłasza na swojej stronie internetowej.”

Article 48a. 1. Who in the state of epidemic threat or state of epidemic does not adhere to the orders, prohibitions or restrictions established on the basis of Article 46 or Article 46b, which are referred to in: art. 46 (4) (1) or Article 46b (5) and 9-12, shall be subject to a financial penalty in the amount from PLN 5,000 to PLN 30,000
3) auxiliary research units of the Academy by limiting the obligation to perform work by employeesthese units within their area

Article 48a. 1. Whoever in an epidemic threat or state of an epidemic shall not adhere to the orders, bans or limitations established on the basis of Article 46 or Article 46b, which are referred to in: Article 46 section 4 point 2 or value 46b point 3, shall be subject to a financial penalty in the amount from PLN 10,000 to PLN 30,000

2) limitation of the obligation to perform work by employees of universities listed in paragraph 1 in their area, except in cases where it is necessary to ensure the continuity of the operation of these universities.

In cases justified by extraordinary circumstances, in particular threatening the life or health of persons qualified to commence specialization training, the minister competent for health may extend the time for commencement of specialization training for a period not longer than 6 months.
